metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9358 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A memory exhaustion vulnerability exists in Asterisk Open Source 13.x before 13.15.1 and 14.x before 14.4.1 and Certified Asterisk 13.13 before 13.13-cert4, which can be triggered by sending specially crafted SCCP packets causing an infinite loop and leading to memory exhaustion (by message logging in that loop).

criterions.comment: asterisk package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4').
